body.title: Powerful visibility at a fraction of the cost
body.description: OpenObserve is an open-source observability platform designed for modern applications, providing comprehensive insights without the hefty price tag.

data.title: Unparalleled Efficiency
data.description: 10x more cost-effective with superior performance compared to traditional solutions

data.title: Deploy in Under 2 Minutes
data.description: Quick setup with minimal configuration to get your observability platform running instantly

data.title: Flexible Deployment Options
data.description: Deploy on-premises, in the cloud, or in hybrid environments to match your infrastructure needs

body.title: Logs with OpenObserve
body.description: Discover how our platform transforms your observability experience

card.title: Lightning-Fast Performance
card.description: Process millions of events per second with minimal latency
card.content: OpenObserve delivers exceptional performance, processing up to 10x more data than traditional solutions while using significantly fewer resources. Our optimized architecture ensures:
features: Sub-second query response times even with terabytes of data
Optimized indexing for faster search and retrieval

card.title: Effortless Scalability
card.description: Scale from gigabytes to petabytes without complexity
card.content: OpenObserve's architecture is designed to scale horizontally with your growing data needs. Whether you're a startup or an enterprise, our platform grows with you:

card.title: Efficient Storage
card.description: Reduce storage costs by up to 80% compared to competitors
card.content: OpenObserve's innovative storage engine dramatically reduces your infrastructure costs while maintaining high performance:
features: Advanced compression algorithms reduce storage requirements
Intelligent data tiering for cost optimization
Flexible retention policies to manage data lifecycle

card.title: Enterprise-Grade Security
card.description: Protect your observability data with comprehensive security features
card.content: OpenObserve provides robust security features to ensure your data remains protected:
features: End-to-end encryption for data in transit and at rest
Fine-grained access controls and role-based permissions

card.title: Real-time Insights
card.description: Immediate visibility into your system's performance and health
card.content: OpenObserve provides real-time monitoring and alerting capabilities to help you respond to issues before they impact your users:
features: Live dashboards with sub-second refresh rates

body.title: Frequently Asked Questions
body.description: Find answers to common questions about OpenObserve and its capabilities

questions.question: What is OpenObserve?
questions.answer: OpenObserve is a cloud-native observability platform designed for logs, metrics, and traces. It's built to be highly efficient, cost-effective, and scalable for modern applications and infrastructure.

questions.question: How does OpenObserve compare to other observability platforms?
questions.answer: OpenObserve offers similar functionality to platforms like Elasticsearch and Grafana Loki but with significantly lower resource requirements. It's designed to be 10x more resource-efficient, which translates to lower infrastructure costs and simpler operations.

questions.question: Is OpenObserve open source?
questions.answer: Yes, OpenObserve is open source and available under the AGPL license. You can find the source code on GitHub and contribute to the project.

questions.question: Can I self-host OpenObserve?
questions.answer: OpenObserve can be self-hosted on your own infrastructure. We provide documentation and support for deploying on Kubernetes, Docker, and other environments.

questions.question: What programming languages and technologies does OpenObserve use?
questions.answer: OpenObserve is primarily built with Rust for the backend services, which provides excellent performance and memory efficiency. The frontend uses modern JavaScript frameworks.

questions.question: How does OpenObserve handle data storage?
questions.answer: OpenObserve uses a columnar database format optimized for observability data. This allows for efficient compression and fast query performance, even with large datasets.

questions.question: What integrations does OpenObserve support?
questions.answer: OpenObserve supports standard protocols like Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Fluent Bit, Vector, and more. It can integrate with most modern application stacks and infrastructure.

questions.question: How does OpenObserve handle high cardinality data?
questions.answer: OpenObserve is designed to efficiently handle high cardinality data through its columnar storage format and optimized indexing strategies, allowing for better performance with dimensionally rich data.

questions.question: How is OpenObserve priced?
questions.answer: OpenObserve offers both open-source and cloud options. The open-source version is free to use. For OpenObserve Cloud, we offer usage-based pricing that scales with your needs, typically at a fraction of the cost of comparable solutions.

questions.question: Is there a free tier for OpenObserve Cloud?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer a generous free tier for OpenObserve Cloud that includes enough capacity for small projects and personal use.

questions.question: How can I estimate my costs for OpenObserve Cloud?
questions.answer: Your costs will primarily depend on your data volume and retention period. We provide a pricing calculator on our website to help you estimate costs based on your specific needs.

questions.question: Do you offer discounts for startups or non-profits?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer special pricing for startups, non-profits, and educational institutions. Please contact our sales team for more information.

questions.question: What support options are available?
questions.answer: We offer community support through our Discord channel and GitHub for the open-source version. For OpenObserve Cloud customers, we provide email support, with additional options for premium support with SLAs available on higher-tier plans.

questions.question: Is there documentation available for OpenObserve?
questions.answer: Yes, we provide comprehensive documentation covering installation, configuration, usage, and best practices at docs.openobserve.ai.

questions.question: Do you offer professional services or implementation help?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer professional services for custom implementations, migrations from other platforms, and optimization of your observability stack. Contact our sales team for details.

questions.question: How can I report bugs or request features?
questions.answer: You can report bugs and request features through our GitHub repository. For OpenObserve Cloud customers, you can also submit requests through our support portal.
